WeaponSystems

Documentation for WeaponSystems.

Introduction

This package creates used to describe weapon systems

julia> using WeaponSystems

Table of contents

  • WeaponSystems
    • Introduction
    • Table of contents
    • Package Features

Package Features

Targets

Circular and rectangular target definition

Weapon systems

Tank

WeaponSystems.Canon — Type
The Canon is defined by:
* θ elevation angle (degrees)
* lw the length of the canon
* u₀ the muzzle velocity magnitude
source
WeaponSystems.Hull — Type
The Hull is defined by :
* Φ: angle of rotation of the tank around the longitudinal axis. If the right side of the tank is lower than the left side,
than this angle is positif.
* Ψ: angle defined by the longitudinal axes of the tank and the horizontal plane
If the nose of the tank is higher than the back, this angle is positif
* Χ: angle defined by the the projection of the longitudinal axis of the tank into an horizontal plane
and the X axis
source
WeaponSystems.Sight — Type
The sight is defined by:
* θ LOS elevation angle
* ξ LOS azimuth angle
source
WeaponSystems.Tank — Type
The tank is defined by: a hull, a turret, a canon, a sight and its position (altitude)
source
WeaponSystems.TargetCirc — Type
TargetCirc(ρ,position)

defines a circular target by specifying the radius ρ and the position (range)

source
WeaponSystems.TargetRect — Type
TargetRect(a,b,position)

defines a rectangular target by specifying the lenght a, the height b and the position (range)

source
WeaponSystems.TargetSphe — Type
TargetSphe(ρ,position)

defines a spherical target by specifying the radius ρ and the position (range)

source
WeaponSystems.Turret — Type
The turret is defined by its azimuth angle
source
WeaponSystems.muzzlePos — Method
muzzlePos(tank)

Returns the coordinates of the muzzle exit in a coordinate system which has the origin on the tank at the base of the the canon

source
WeaponSystems.targetPos — Method
targetPos(target,tank)

Is a function that returns the coordinates of the target in a coordinate system which has the origin on the tank at the base of the the canon

source
